<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 418, 222, 432]]<|/det|>
## INSTRUCTIONS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 434, 880, 636]]<|/det|>
INSTRUCTIONS- Answer all questions.- Use a black or dark blue pen. You may use an HB pencil for any diagrams or graphs.- Write your name, centre number and candidate number in the boxes at the top of the page.- Write your answer to each question in the space provided.- Do not use an erasable pen or correction fluid.- Do not write on any bar codes.- If additional space is needed, you should use the lined page at the end of this booklet; the question number or numbers must be clearly shown.- You should use a calculator where appropriate.- You must show all necessary working clearly; no marks will be given for unsupported answers from a calculator.- Give non- exact numerical answers correct to 3 significant figures, or 1 decimal place for angles in degrees, unless a different level of accuracy is specified in the question.  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 664, 212, 678]]<|/det|>
## INFORMATION  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 680, 728, 711]]<|/det|>
INFORMATION- The total mark for this paper is 75.- The number of marks for each question or part question is shown in brackets [ ].

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[79, 81, 96, 100]]<|/det|>
<label>2</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 75, 920, 131]]<|/det|>
The equation of a curve is such that \(\frac{\mathrm{dy}}{\mathrm{dx}} = 4(2x - 5)^3 - 9x^{\frac{1}{2}}\). The curve passes through the point \(A\left(4, -\frac{11}{2}\right)\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 140, 144, 159]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 140, 611, 159]]<|/det|>
Find the gradient of the normal to the curve at the point \(A\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[895, 140, 920, 159]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 168, 917, 467]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 482, 148, 500]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 482, 398, 500]]<|/det|>
Find the equation of the curve.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[892, 482, 920, 500]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 509, 917, 935]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[79, 73, 94, 90]]<|/det|>
<label>3</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 72, 920, 107]]<|/det|>
The third term of a geometric progression is 18 and the sum of the first three terms is 26. It is given that the common ratio is negative.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 120, 146, 138]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 120, 845, 138]]<|/det|>
Find the tenth term of the progression. Give your answer correct to 3 significant figures. [5]

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 148, 915, 720]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 737, 148, 756]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 737, 635, 756]]<|/det|>
Find the exact value of the sum to infinity of the progression. [2]

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 766, 915, 945]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[826, 945, 905, 963]]<|/det|>
<mark>[Turn over

<label>4</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[117, 320, 873, 355]]<|/det|>
The diagram shows the curve with equation \(y = 5x^{\frac{3}{2}} - 20x\) and the line with equation \(y = x - 16\). The \(x\)-coordinates of the points of intersection of the curve and line are 1 and 16.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[117, 368, 630, 386]]<|/det|>
Find the area of the shaded region between the curve and the line.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 368, 918, 386]]<|/det|>
<mark>[5]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[82, 72, 97, 90]]<|/det|>
<label>5</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[119, 72, 149, 90]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[158, 72, 918, 106]]<|/det|>
Find the first three terms, in ascending powers of \(x\), in the expansion of each of the following expressions.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 120, 180, 138]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[195, 120, 267, 138]]<|/det|>
\[(2 - px)^5\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 120, 918, 138]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[146, 148, 917, 343]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 338, 180, 358]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 337, 917, 375]]<|/det|>
\[\left(1 - \frac{1}{2} x\right)^4 \quad [2]\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 338, 918, 358]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 564, 149, 583]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 562, 918, 606]]<|/det|>
Given that the coefficient of \(x^{2}\) in the expansion of \(\left(2 - px\right)^{5}\left(1 - \frac{1}{2} x\right)^{4}\) is 93, find the possible values of the constant \(p\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 585, 918, 605]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[146, 616, 917, 945]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[79, 75, 94, 93]]<|/det|>
<label>6</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 75, 918, 110]]<|/det|>
The equation of a curve is \(2x^{2} - kxy + 2 = 0\) and the equation of a line is \(y = px + 3\), where \(k\) and \(p\) are constants.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 122, 144, 140]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 122, 918, 155]]<|/det|>
Given that \(k = 2\) and \(p = 11\), find the coordinates of the points of intersection of the curve and the line. [4]

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 166, 915, 945]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 73, 146, 90]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 73, 918, 107]]<|/det|>
Given instead that \(p = 4\), find the set of values of \(k\) for which the curve and the line do not intersect. [5]

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[153, 123, 917, 952]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[79, 79, 96, 98]]<|/det|>
<label>7</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[119, 77, 465, 104]]<|/det|>
The equation of a curve is \(y = 4x^{2} + \frac{9}{x^{2}} - 8.\)

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[117, 120, 148, 138]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 120, 920, 153]]<|/det|>
A point \(P\) is moving along the curve in such a way that its \(y\)-coordinate is decreasing at 5 units per second.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 166, 737, 185]]<|/det|>
Find the rate at which the \(x\)-coordinate of point \(P\) is changing when \(x = 2\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[892, 166, 920, 185]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 196, 917, 928]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 73, 146, 90]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 72, 811, 90]]<|/det|>
Find the coordinates of the stationary points of the curve and determine their nature. [5]

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 103, 917, 945]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 75, 94, 94]]<|/det|>
<label>8</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 75, 900, 96]]<|/det|>
The circle with equation \(x^{2} + y^{2} - 6x + 10y - 27 = 0\) intersects the line \(x = -2\) at the points \(P\) and \(Q\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 107, 920, 128]]<|/det|>
Find the area of the triangle formed by the tangents to the circle at \(P\) and \(Q\), and the line \(x = -2\). [8]

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 138, 917, 952]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[79, 72, 94, 90]]<|/det|>
<label>9</label>

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[337, 85, 660, 250]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 266, 918, 303]]<|/det|>
The diagram shows a sector \(ABC\) of a circle with centre \(A\) and radius \(r\mathrm{cm}\). The angle \(BAC\) is \(\alpha\) radians, where \(0< \alpha < \frac{1}{2}\pi\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 317, 148, 335]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[158, 316, 887, 335]]<|/det|>
It is given that the area of the triangle \(ABC\) is \(4 \mathrm{cm}^2\) and the area of the sector \(ABC\) is \(8 \alpha \mathrm{cm}^2\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 348, 490, 367]]<|/det|>
Find the exact area of the shaded segment.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[892, 348, 922, 367]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 81, 148, 100]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 77, 920, 128]]<|/det|>
It is given instead that the length of the chord \(BC\) is \(\frac{1}{\sqrt{2}} r \text{cm}\) but the area of the triangle \(ABC\) is still \(4 \text{cm}^2\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 138, 920, 158]]<|/det|>
Find the area of the shaded segment. Give your answer correct to 3 significant figures. [4]

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 168, 917, 945]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[79, 72, 106, 88]]<|/det|>
<label>10</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[119, 72, 403, 88]]<|/det|>
The functions f and g are defined by

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[364, 101, 628, 120]]<|/det|>
\[\mathrm{f}(x) = \sqrt{x}\qquad \mathrm{for} x\geqslant 0,\]

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[364, 132, 633, 151]]<|/det|>
\[\mathrm{g}(x) = 3\sqrt{x + 2} -5\qquad \mathrm{for} x\geqslant -2.\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 164, 146, 182]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 164, 917, 197]]<|/det|>
Describe fully a sequence of transformations which transforms the graph of \(y = \mathrm{f}(x)\) to the graph of \(y = \mathrm{g}(x)\). You should make clear the order in which the transformations are applied. [5]

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[153, 210, 917, 570]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[200, 583, 797, 848]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 861, 452, 879]]<|/det|>
The diagram shows the graph of \(y = \mathrm{g}(x)\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 891, 146, 910]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 891, 825, 910]]<|/det|>
On the diagram sketch the graph of \(y = \mathrm{g}^{-1}(x)\) together with any relevant mirror line. [2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 75, 144, 93]]<|/det|>
<label>(c)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 75, 395, 93]]<|/det|>
Find an expression for \(\mathrm{g}^{-1}(x)\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[892, 75, 918, 95]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 104, 915, 345]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 355, 146, 373]]<|/det|>
<label>(d)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 355, 335, 373]]<|/det|>
State the range of \(\mathrm{g}^{-1}\) .

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 355, 918, 374]]<|/det|>
<mark>[1]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 448, 341, 466]]<|/det|>
<pre>The function h is defined by

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[396, 477, 602, 496]]<|/det|>
<pre>\[\mathrm{h}(x) = x - 2\qquad \mathrm{for} x\geqslant 0.\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 510, 144, 528]]<|/det|>
<label>(e)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 510, 366, 528]]<|/det|>
Find the value of \(\mathrm{g}^{-1}\mathrm{h}(4)\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 510, 918, 528]]<|/det|>
<mark>[1]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 725, 144, 744]]<|/det|>
<label>(f)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 725, 630, 744]]<|/det|>
Explain why the composite function \(\mathrm{hg}^{-1}\) cannot be formed.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 725, 918, 744]]<|/det|>
<mark>[1]
